summary: This document is an addendum to the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) in the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. It clarifies provisions regarding the selection and payment of an attorney representative for victims, specifying that Epstein will pay the attorney's fees unless contested litigation is filed against him. The document includes signatures from the U.S. Attorney and Epstein's legal counsel.

events.title: Signing of Addendum to Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: The parties signed an addendum to clarify provisions of the original Non-Prosecution Agreement regarding victim attorney representation and payment.

keyFacts: The addendum clarifies that the U.S. can assign an independent third-party to select an attorney representative for victims, with Epstein's counsel having good faith approval rights.

Jeffrey Epstein agreed to pay the hourly rate for the victim attorney representative, but this obligation ceases if the attorney files contested litigation (e.g., under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255) against him.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta and Epstein's attorneys Gerald Lefcourt and Lilly Ann Sanchez, indicating high-level legal approval of the modified terms.
The original Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) is referenced, confirming its existence and the ongoing legal negotiations surrounding Epstein's case.
